headline.main: Observations on the Climate and Diseases of Anstralia.

docs.lead_paragraph: Extract from a Letter from Dr. Geo. Fullerton to the N. Y. Medical Times: In reply to your inquiry respecting the discoses prevalent in Australia, I may say that most of the ills incident o Europeans in other climates, have been imported into that continent, excepting the Plague, Asiatic Cholera, Yellow Fever, and Small Pox.

headline.main: Fever and Ague in the Outskirts.

docs.lead_paragraph: "STONE" must certainly write again. His brief note has had the effect to surround us with the most healthful "outskirts" that ever blessed a dirty City. From all around us and from every side we have testimony that interments are among the curiosities of medical experience only, and that disease of any sort is a "rare bird." ." From the multitudinous

docs.lead_paragraph: From the London Athenaum. After a long period of decline and helpless suffering., cheerfully borne, the author of Our Village," died at Swallowfield Cottage, near Reading, on Wednesday last, aged--as a memorandum furnished by herself some years ago assures us--sixty-six years.

docs.lead_paragraph: The fire which broke out at No. 140 Fultonstreet, (between Nassan-street and Broadway,) at about 1 1/2 o'clock A. M. yesterday--a brief report of which was published in the TIMES of the same morning--was the most disastrous that has occurred in the City for some time.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Union steamer, of the Havre line, arrived at this port on Saturday evening. Her mails are not so late by three days as the previous advices by the Africa at Boston. They complete the foreign files, however, from which we make the following extracts:

headline.main: THE AFRICA'S MAILS.; The Tricks of Secret Diplomacy in and with Piedmont. THE AFRICA'S MAILS. KOSSUTH ON PIEDMONT. From the London Sunday Times. The Tricks of Secret Diplomacy in and with Piedmont. The Piedmontese Government has joined the alliance of the Western Powers. From the London Sunday Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Piedmontese Government has joined the alliance of the Western Powers. England and L. N. BONAPARTE, with Turkey to boot, despairing of their ability to cope successfully with the Czar, cry out to Sardinia, " Help, Cassius, or we sink!" and lean Cassius steps in, and all is safe. safe.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; The Creoles' Petition to Consul Robertson never Delivered-Estrames' Letter Not Obtained from the Consul-Arrivals-Markets, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Having seen published in tile New-York Herald of the 17th inst. a letter puporting to be addressed by the creoles of Cuba to the United States Consulate at the Havana, although without signature, I called there yesterday to prefer the request that I might be allowed to see the original.
